dataset.title: Sikfokut LTER (Hungary) - aboveground net primary production 2011-2012 - EnvEurope A5

creator.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

metadataProvider.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

section.para: This dataset provides data about annual net primary production in the Síkfőkút LTER site (Hungary). Annual dry mass increment of canopy Quercus petraea and Q. cerris trees in 2011 and 2012 was assessed by tree ring and allometry data and corrected with tree mortality. Total litterfall in 2012 provides information on renewable biomass flux.

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:EnvEurope (LTER-Europe) has granted a permission of type:Other restrictions according to rules defined in itellectual rights
Co-authorship on publications resulting from use of the dataset
The opportunity to collaborate on the project using the dataset

contact.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

para.literalLayout: Analysis of annual tree increment by tree rings and calculation of dry weight change by allometry equations. Assessment of total litter production by litter traps.

methodStep.instrumentation: Tree rings: increment borer, digital scanner, ImageJ image analyses software. Litterfall: litter traps.

section.para: Stand-level biomass increment was assessed by tree ring analyses. In 2011 130 Q. petraea and 99 Q. cerris samples were analyzed. In 2012 19-19 Q. petraea and Q. cerris samples were analyzed. All samples were collected in the permanent 1 hectare plot of the LTER site. Mean tree ring widths were used in allometry equations to calculate aboveground biomass change tree-by-tree and sum up to stand level using tree inventory of the site. Yearly increments were corrected by tree mortality data. Litterfall was assessed in 2012 using 25 litter traps representing the permanent hectare of the site, with 5.11 m2 total area and transformed to kg/ha.
